August 11 at 2:12 PM ·

Summer is winding down, and students will soon head back to school. Do you know when to stop for a stopped school bus?

On a two-lane road, motorists traveling in BOTH directions must stop for a school bus that has its amber/red lights flashing. On roads with four or more lanes, only motorists traveling behind the stopped school bus must stop. Motorists approaching the stopped bus from the opposite direction do not have to stop. #TargetZeroTuesday

We have a limited number of spots available in our 4 year old lab school program at all three high schools. This is a tuition based program open to employees of our district, as well as residents within our district. The program runs Monday – Friday and is open from 6:55 AM – 4:20 PM. Students are expected to be at school by 8:30 each day. Parents must provide their own transportation to and from school each day.

The 4 year old lab school program will start on August 31, 2020 and end on June 18, 2021. Your child must be four years old on or before September 1, 2020 to enroll in this program. If you are interested in learning more please contact Holli Pinski at pinskih@fortmillschools.org.

Using the data received from the recent Bus Transportation Form, the district has determined a change to the elementary school end time is needed to allow more time for bus transportation in the afternoons. At this time, we do not anticipate any changes to the start or end times for the middle and high schools.

⭐️Elementary schools will now operate from 7:35 a.m. to 1:40 p.m. daily. Morning drop off time for car riders will continue to begin at 7:05 a.m.⭐️

Under the Family Model, students will not be transitioning for related arts or meals which will allow the district to make this adjustment without impacting instructional time.

This change will allow buses to complete elementary routes with little to no disruption to the middle and high school routes. We ask for everyone’s patience as we work through any transportation issues that may arise during the first few weeks of school.

⭐Congratulations to Nation Ford High School, selected as a finalist for the 2020 Palmetto's Finest award! NFHS is one of only THREE high schools in the state to be selected as a finalist. They have been named a finalist for two years in a row! ⭐

Seven schools from around the state have been selected as finalists for the 2020 Palmetto’s Finest awards. This selection comes after extensive evaluations by a committee of fellow educators and previous Palmetto’s Finest winners. The application process includes elements on student achievement, instructional programs, professional learning communities, and school culture.The South Carolina Association of School Administrators (SCASA) presents the awards each year to schools which offer the best in innovative, effective educational programs.

Way to go, NAFO!

Congratulations to the Banks Trail Middle School Battle of the Books team for winning both the county-wide battle of the books competition at Rawlinson Road Middle school last night!

Battle of the books is a program that begins in August with the middle school teams reading a selection of 10 books. The game-show style "battles" quiz the students on the content of those books.

Congratulations to team members Addison Bache, Layla Brindisi, Adrian Gutierrez, Justin Isch and Evie Martell, pictured here with coaches Sara Davis (BTMS Media Specialist) and Melissa Saunders (6th grade ELA teacher).
